text: Draft - Pours cloudy gold with white head. Nose/taste of smoked stone fruit, juniper, wild yeast, lemongrass and herbal notes. Medium body.

Bottle. Moderate straw for the malt, herbs and grass for the hops, moderate to heavy barnyard, peat and earth for the yeast, with white wine, smoke, wood and pepper. Head is average to large, frothy/fizzy, white with good lacing and is fully lasting. Color is murky medium amber. Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately to heavily acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is light to medium, watery with a fizzy carbonation and a dry finish. An extremely earthy and somewhat fruity smelling Saison posing as a Traditional Ale. It is a touch flat tasting in the finish.
650ml bottle pours a golden color with a lot of head. Nice Brett flavor but not so keen on the smokiness.

[6314-20140509] Bottle. Smoked salmon wood aroma. Slightly hazy, pale orange body with a medium-lasting foamy white head. Flavour is a bit like a wet sauna with its smoked wood chips. Medium body. Good. (6/3/7/3/14) 3.3
(@ Volo, Toronto, ON)
Aroma is yeast, spices/a decent hint of heat and citrus. The flavor is citrus, spices, a hint of funk, juniper berries and a mix of slight heat and medicinal in the finish.
bottle. Hazy golden with two finger head. Lightly tart with substantial funk. Mild berry fruitiness. Dry. Improved as it warmed. Excellent.

750 ml bottle shared with the Quebec City crew. Pours a subtly veiled straw with a short lived white head. Aroma is cheesy, tart, smokey, nutty. Flavor is fresh, malty, orchard fruit, smokey, wheat, tropical fruits. Finish is smokey, herbal, white flour and lemon. Medium body, soft, velvety mouthfeel, average carbonation.

22oz bomber from willblake, love that Jon saw "Viking style saison" and thought of me. Poured a cloudy yellow body with a long lasting average to larger frothy white head. Aroma is smoke, juniper, yeast, Belgian spice. Palate is nice medium, average carbonation, creamy body. Flavor of smoke, juniper, floral, yeast, smoked bread and bubble gum. Interesting and gets better with time.

Where and how:  Bottle at Volo, 650 ml bottle 
Aroma funk fruity tartness, vitamin C, red apple. Softer walls. Milder smoky notes behind.
 Appearance : 
Top: medium rocky top with some rings on glass.
Base: hazy amber.
Palate :  smoother front with drier finish. 
Taste: frontal mild smoke with farm feel. Organic garden vibe to it with mild tartness. If smoke was more pronounced this could be quiet nice.
Tart, earthy aroma; subtle smoke and juniper. Stronger smoke in the flavor. Earthy; the tartness is there, but its more subdued. A little juniper and floral flavor.

Bottle shared by Dallas 
Clear golden with a medium sized white head, good lacing. Aroma is smoky, perfume and straw. Flavor is mildly tart, smoky and straw  
Nice & clean
Gold, slight haze, off-white head. Aroma of grainy malt, smoke, perfume, a little sour lemon. Flavor: some light sweaty funk, smoke, some lemon, not getting much juniper, interesting beer.

Bottle from QFC-U Village.
Hazy straw pour, fluffy white head. Lovely sour woody aroma with prominent brett, hay. Gently sweet, juniper, ginger, more brett funk than sourness but certainly some lemon and grapefruit juices. Im not getting the smoke that is supposed to be here.  Im not really in the market for 12oz bottles at $9/each, but this one seemed interesting enough to make an exception. And interesting it is.
Cloudy dark golden color. Unique aroma and taste with smoke and sour standing out. $5.99/22 ounce seemed reasonable.

22 oz bottle, my bottle says nothing about import series vol 5, all it says is Scandinavian Style Farmhouse ale with no description, assuming this is the right one- Pours hazy light golden with a thin white head that reduces. Aroma is brett off the bat, very funky and barnyard, citrusy. The taste is brett, but with some spices, juniper is definitely there, want to say sage, but that is probably the juniper bush, it actually tastes like a dried up sage and or juniper bush i would imagine would taste like, the touch of smoke adds a ashy finish to the beer. Different and good, never heard of using a whole bush to brew beer, i wonder if they broke it up at all or just threw full bushes in the boil?
Very mild gusher when being opened. Low carbonation, medium body. Aroma of leather, gauze, tarp, quite funky. Funky, though not overly sour, with notes of leather, overripe fruit, and a bit of smoke.
Funky, smoke, leather. Low carbonation despite almost being a gusher when opened. Some residual sweetness to finish.

Bottle. Huge gusher. Strong aroma and extra strong taste of ethyl acetate. Undrinkable. Looked good, though. Would normally not rate an obviously infected beer, but since Stillwater has chosen to charge a big premium for their beers, the expectations are higher  and infections are unacceptable.

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, no bottle dating. Moderate gusher upon opening. Pours slightly hazy bright gold color with a 2 finger dense and fluffy white head with great retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of big lemon, pear, apple, juniper, clove, pepper, hay, straw, grass, wheat, bread, musty funk, light wood smoke, and herbal/yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of fruity/spicy/funky yeast, juniper, pale malt, and light smoke notes; with good strength. Taste of lemon, pear, apple, juniper, clove, pepper, hay, straw, grass, herbal, wood smoke, wheat, bread, light musty funk, and herbal/yeast earthiness. Fair amount of earthy yeast spiciness and some slight tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, pear, apple, clove, pepper, juniper, hay, straw, grass, herbal, wheat, bread, light wood smoke, and herbal/yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Very nice complexity and balance of fruity/spicy/funky yeast, juniper, pale malt, and moderate smoke flavors; with a great malt/yeast/spice balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, and lightly prickly mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent smoked/juniper saison. All around great complexity and balance of fruity/spicy/funky yeast, juniper, pale malt, and moderate smoke flavors; and very smooth and crisp to drink. A very enjoyable offering.

2014-05-09. Hazy dark yellow body with a small white head 3+ Aroma of charred wood, burnt matchsticks minus the actual match, cereally pale malt and notes of flour follow. 6-7 Flavour is lightly tangy, cereally pale malt, wheat touches, smoke undertones are slower to grow here, odd lightly corn like vegetal character in background reminds me of Classique but presents itself less pleasantly here. Average plus palate with soft carbonation. Decent but really not to my tastes. Bottle sample at Volo, Toronto

22oz bottle Pours a slightly hazy golden straw color with a very nice pillowy white head that is holding up very nicely, some very nice lace sticking to the rim of my glass. Aroma is of smoke, black pepper, bread dough and grass. Flavor is light dryish fruit, juniper, bread and pepper. Finish is earthy and lightly smokey. Scandanavian (type O?) Farmhouse Ale as the label reads, I like it, very drinkable and refreshing, great beer. Brothers Sindri and Brokkr would approve, now wheres my Mjölnir!

Cloudy gold color. Aroma is yeasty, citrusy, and barnyardy. Sips highly carbonated, orangey/lemony, spiced. Middle is belgian yeasty. Moderately malty sweet with a light lingering smokiness. Overall very Sessionable, moderately spicy, smoky brew.
BOTTLE AT bar VOLO. Intense barnyard in the flavour, for those who like that sort of thing. Smooth and a sipper over a meal. Lacy.

Draft at 33 wine shop and bar. Pours golden with an inch of white foam. Nice juniper notes on the nose. Definitely has some farmhouse on the tongue. Finishes clean. This may not be a saison but it sure presents as one.

Bottle. Lemonade-colored beer, very light yet opaque. Spills an odd funk in the nose. It gets even odder on the tongue ... a strong, smoky ash-filled chew is intermingled with a very light fruity backdrop. Its a quirky mix that just misses the target IMHO. (#5495, 4/23/2014)

Hazy orange pour big beauty head. Overflowed a bit out of the bottle. Aroma of smoke, juniper, bretta, yeast, spicy grain. Tastes briny, tart, yeast, quite mild in every way, but pleasant. Smoke blends right in there. Nice dry finish. Very good!

Glowing hazy golden straw with ample, fluffy white head that dissipates. Fruity, pepper, hay, yeast on the nose. White wine mild fruity sweetness kicks off the flavor, fading to flashes of juniper, leather and pepper, finishing with mild ashy beechwood smoke. Blown away by how well this was pulled off.

Pour out of 22 oz bottle, hazy golden-yellow pour with white head, aroma brought notes of lemon, herbal notes into a bit of spice, yeast, some biscuit, bready notes, hints of grain, slight hint of smoke, pretty nice smelling. Taste is a mix of grass, biscuit, tea, herbal, grainy notes into some lemon, smoke, brett and oaky notes, finishing fairly bitter, dry, smoky.

Cloudy light tan. No head. Aroma shows a lot of pale malt, smoke, peachy fruitiness, a hint of tartness...strange stuff. Sweet, smokey, a touch of acidity, really nice clean malt. This is definitely an interesting beer, with abundant character. A hint of footy hefeweizen-like yeast...unique brew.

Bottle. Cloudy gold with a tall foamy white head. Bottle foamed over within seconds of opening. Aroma is strong, funky yeast, juniper, faint peppery notes, faint ashy notes, light smoke, dried malt and earthy notes. Taste is funky yeast, juniper notes, light smoke, dried fruit, earthy notes, floral hops, dried malt, sourdough bread and tart fruit. Body is medium with a moderate carbonation and dry during the finish. Ends with more funky yeast notes, floral hops, earthy notes, tart fruit, juniper notes and faint smoky notes.

Bottle poured a hazy golden color with a thick one finger head that retained the whole glass through. Aroma has brett, smoked grains, bit of dusty farmhouse, and light pepper. Mouth feel is light and the carbonation medium. Flavor again has brett, wheat, light smoke, grains, some pepper, and clover. I get light juniper but only because I read the description.

bottle shared by JM, thanks dude. pours hazy light yellow with a small whtie cap, some retention and lacing. wheat, lightly smoked grains - lean maltiness, pepper, meaty, lactic and cheesy, shy bretts, bitter herbs, lemon, leather touch. average carbonation, light body, dry smoky-herbal-grassy finish. interesting stuff, but does not quite lift it to next level.

Bottle 660ml.
Pours blond with low white head. Minimal lacing. Aroma is of sulfur, smoke. Taste is of malt, yeast, sulfur, bitterness, slight smoke. Palate: Light-medium body. Light-medium carbonation. Overall: OK. Yeast action is a bit weird. Smoke.

Bottle (22 oz). Shared by JM, thanks! Clear yellow with a small persistent white head and little lacing. Aroma is lemony with smoke, farmhouse yeast, some fruits and a touch of funk. Taste is slightly sweet with smoke (a little more than in the aroma), lemony notes and farmhouse yeast. Medium body. Good carbonation. Slightly dry finish. The smokey presence seems to be intentional, but I dont think its a good addition to the beer. Its decent, but subpar for Stillwater and the Brunello barrel-aged version is so much better!

Bottle shared by Jean-Michael, thanks! Pours a cloudy and pale yellow with a weak head that leaves only minimal lacing. Aroma is of smoke, fruits and a little bit of funk. Taste is smoky, fruity and features some nice and fresh cereals. There is also a slightly peppery finish to it. Body is light, carbonation medium-high. Nice one, really unusual and tasty.

Bottle to glass. Hazy yellow Orange pour with a thin white head. Nose is funky citrus hay with notes of clove and smoke. Taste is a bit of citrus up front, lots of hay, into a musty semi bitter finish.

12oz pour at the source pours a very hazy straw yellow with some sudsy white head. Nose is odd, lemon, peppercorns, light smoke, a little spruce, soap. Flavor has an interesting medicinal, soap, lavender, juniper, some grass. Herbal finish.

Somewhat hazy light golden color. Creamy white head. Spicy nose that is surprisingly clovey for the style. More similar to a hefe in the nose. Also notes of wheat and pepper. Light body, dry peppery, fairly hoppy. Refreshing and very quaffable. Doesnt have the depth to take me anywhere special, but it is enjoyable.

Bottle (brewed by Westbrook in SC).

Head is initially small, fizzy/frothy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly hoppy (flowers, herbs), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with light notes of pepper, gum/banana, eucalyptus, alcohol.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

Yet another beer from Stillwater that has seemingly changed contracts, at least for the CO market (nothing about "Import Series" on my sample either). Amusingly, "Scandinavian" is misspelled on the label as "Scandanavian". A straightforward and rather characterless rendition, but not bad...doesnt make a lot of the usual mistakes like being too sweet or too boozy. Very watery.
Bottled from wf-UES. Cloudy yellow pour. Woody smoke and yeasty funk. Floral and citrus. Pretty good.
Draft at blue monk. Straw colored pour. Wispy white head. Some fruity yeast, light smoke, light Brett funk. Nice

Bottle from whole foods for MNF. Pours hazy greenish yellow but in pretty way, and an electric white head. Nose is light funk and smoke and citrus. Tastes of fresh grass, lightly peppery, some hint of smoke, lemon peel, and yeast. Ill assume that slightly different flavor on finish is juniper. Dry palate and well carbonated.

Bottle. Pours a clear dark gold body under a large fizzy white head that had excellent retention due to vigorous carbonation. Lots of nice lacing. Really interesting aroma, lots of brett yeast influence, a light hint of smokiness, and not a whole lot of noticeable juniper smell. Smells like a really funky Saison. The flavor still has a decent amount of juniper, but the flavor is much more dominated by the brett at this point. There might be a touch of smoke on the finish, but its pretty light. A little bit of tartness adds a little vibrancy to the flavor. Some light cereal grain like maltiness below it all. Lighter bodied with a lot of fizzy prickly carbonation, a light bit of cling on the finish. Pretty interesting beer, not sure Id drink it with any regularity though. A once and done experience.

Whole Foods Bowery, NYC 750ml ($10): Pours cloudy light orange with a small white head. Aroma is bretty funk, some smoke, some berry up in there too. Taste is funky, a tad bitter, somewhat smoky. Body is rather light and, actually, almost a bit watery. Pleasant aftertaste. Interesting stuff.

Hazy Dark Golden pour with thin off white head, Brett, Juniper, Hop nose. Medium creamy body, generally bitter but maltier towards the back. Slightly smokey, sticky finish. 

Very interesting.

Yum, yum, yum. This is another one of those Im so delicate Im loud politely kind of brews. Splash of Berliner Weisse, splash of juniper, hint of a lemongrass, hint of barnyardy citrus, and a splash of smoke (somehow) on the finish. Tiny bits of aged hop in there somewhere as well. Goddamn good stuff!

Had it in Copenhagen around CBC 2012 - maybe at the festival, maybe at Mikkeller Bar or something. Pours lightly hazy, yellow-gold with a fine, pure white foam head. Big tangy malt nose, some apple and white cherries. Medium sweet flavor with further tang, light sourness, some bread. Light to medium in body with fine carbonation. Moderate sweetness to finish, light dryness, some ripe and sour lemon, mild dough and butter, light funk, tangy bread. Pretty refreshing thanks to the edgy tartness. A bit of lingering grassy bitterness. Nice.

Hazy orange
Nose is citrus floral and spice
Lovely Brett funk. Tastes like tangerine juice. Funky and tannic. Spice is minimal

Bottle at Bier Stein, Eugene. Hazy golden color lots of funk in aroma lots of head. Tart, barnyard, just amazing. Body lively, finish somewhat sweet and fruity. Really nice, great yeast strain. Maybe a touch of hop bitterness . Really superb, my fellow raters are quite justified!
Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen december 2012. Hazy golden beer with a big offwhite head. Fruity, citrus sweetsourish aroma. Similar flavour. Nice and refreshing beer :-)

Bottle from Malt & Vine. Pours hazy gold with a lightly lacing white head. Aroma is earthy, fruity, citrus. Med body. Flavor is earthy, tinge sour, citrus. with a little fruit. finish is earthy/sour - but mild sour. Gets a little grapey with time. Nice and refined.
Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours blonde with an attractive white head and a sour fruity aroma. There is a carbonated fruit flavor that resembles pear and finishes very winey.

Draft. Pours hazy yellow with a good lasting and good lacing frothy white head. Aroma is biscuit malt, flowery hops, grapefruit, intense estery fruityness (hubba-bubba), citrus, peppery, spicy and some phenols. Taste is light sweet and bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.  Finishes dry and a little spicy -  very elegant.
Tap @ MikkellerBar. Slightly hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, brett, hop and a little citrus. Flavour is malt, brett, hop, yeast, spices, little citrus and medium bitter.

Gushed like a volcano once the cap was popped ~ luckily the glass was close.  Poured hazy golden with a huge white head.  The aroma is powdery/flowery with light toast, hibiscus, herbs, mild malt, peach and lemon.  It has a medium body with a huge amount of frothy micro sharp carbonation.  The flavor starts with dry fruit, spice, cellar must, earthy saison-ish yeast, apple and floral aspects.  The finish has leafy dry herbs, peach, hint of smoke, leather and ginger.  Another beer that is quite nice from Stillwater.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar. Hazy light golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of fruity funk, lemons, cereal, pepper, wheat and fruit. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of fruity funk and wheat. Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Awesome stuff, nicely funky.

Bottle: a bit expensive but sometimes that's something you have to stomach for rarity. Pours hazy pale yellow with a lasting white head. Bretty, barnyard funk, oak barrel, floral juniper, smoke, citric acids on the nose. Acidity on the palate, complex smokiness with granny apples, oak barrels, Brett, some tartness and drying on the finish. Really well done by one of the leaders in Farmhouse today. Can I get a keg?

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Somewhat hazy pale golden beer with a very nice lasting firm offwhite head. Bready yeasty aroma, brett, stable, leather, vinous, biscuits, faint notes of smoke, caramel, citrus, some grapefruit, tart, floral and with some spices. Spicy wheat flavor, brett, stable, yeast, sourish, rubber notes, dandelions, tart, floral, biscuits, some underlying smoke that also brings some sweetness, apples, grapefruit, bitter grass. Nice body and with a sourish floral finish with spicy notes. Very nice beer!

Bottle. Pours a clear pale yellow gold with a large white head that lasts throughout the beer. Aroma has a good amount of sweet grains and flora with some underlying grassiness and just a bit of light sweet fruit. Flavor starts with sweet light fruits and flora with a good amount of grassiness with just a hint of brett funkiness.

Bottle from Stateline. Very interesting and delicious beer. Pours pale orange with a white head. Bready aroma with some Brett notes. Flavor is dry, lightly tart and smoky. Notes of grass and hay. Some apple and grape notes. Dry bitter finish. Very drinkable.
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2012 From the tap poured a golden color with a good amount of head.  Light malty sour flavor with a lingering finish.

Sampled at Dans after Top of the Hops tasting.  Clear yellow pour with good layer of white head.  Nose of rose petals. Citrus lemon and grapefruit rind hop.  Very clean and enjoyable. Lingering deliciousness. Very good. and as always, amazing label art.

12 ounce bottle from State Line. Pours a hazy yellow color with a large frothy white head. Decent head retention. Aroma of tart fruits, strawberries, herbal notes. The taste is tart strawberries, cherries, apricots, herbal notes. Medium bodied. Tasty.
Pineapple aroma. Cloudy golden, thick head. Unripe banana. Farily tame by Stillwater standards. A little boozy.

Bottle to oversized snifter. Looks good; a semi-transparent orange with thin white lacing. Smells good; sweet, funky, and a little smoky. Tastes like it smells, but more juniper than Id prefer. Average on the palate. Good, but with less Juniper it would be great.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Very spice. Light funky yeast aromas tones. Flavor is floral, potpourri, light spices and berry.

Bottle. Its a clear, golden beer gaining some lacings from the big, creamy, off-white head. Its lightly sour on the nose, with fruityness, oranges mostly, pine cones and a faint touch of spices. Not much smoke to be detected. The flavor has oranges and citrus peel, pale malts and some bretty hints. Its more or less full-bodied, dry, and nicely carbonated. A pleasant bitterness in the end. A pleasant and tasteful beer. 120302

aroma is very horsey, mostly brett, a bit of smoke and citrus and spices. flavor is sour in front and smoke in back, long sour-smokey finish. really interesting stuff, though not sure i enjoy smokey and sour together. sharp carbonation, medium body keeps it from being overwhelming
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, malt, yeast, fruit, spices. Flavour is citrus, malt, yeast, flower, orange, fruit, spices. Nice beer.

Bottle:  Hazy golden, large rocky white head, sticky lacing.  Nice bright floral nose, also strong pale breadiness.  Translates exactly the same on the tongue.  Nice bright floral flavors, spritzy, airy, with a good pale breadiness.  Body and mouthfeel are moderate and airy.  Nice bright floral finish, a bit of a wheaty spunk.  Good stuff!

Bottle @ Fano. Hazy blonde appearance with an off white head. Very bretty, pineapple, mango, citrusy, yeasty nose. A bit vinous, tropical fruity, again very bretty, spicy yeasty flavor. Very nice one.

Pours a pleasant straw blonde color with a fluffy white three finger head that burst with wonderful aromas of spicy funky brett, sweet watermelon, wildflower bubblegum, fresh chopped oak, dust and lemon pepper zest. I can tell by the nose that this is my kind of beer ! The palate follows the nose beautifully with nice complexity and balance between funky, rustic, fruity, spicy, refreshing, yet bold.  Getting a bit more sourness and juniper on the midpalate and a nice spicy smokey finish that lingers just enough to bring it back to its earthy existence !

Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2012. Pours slightly hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is slightly sour with brett, fruit, oak, spices. Taste is brett, spices, oaky, sweet  fruit, apples, peach, light sourness. Thhin to medium body, lively carbonation. 110512
CBC. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity, yeasty, spicy and light bretty. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish. 110512

Very good beer.  Pours a perfect looking saison type pour.  Aroma is juniper berries, earthy yeast, herbal notes, and raw dough.  Taste is crisp and dry with a touch of juniper berry sweetness.  Liked it a lot.
Stupid expensive bottle, good juniper flavors, great saison yeast strain, another great Stillwater

Bottle from a trade with michael-pollack. Pours hazy pale straw color with a huge white head. Aromas of brett, dough, and spices. Tart citrus flavor with brett and spices with light doughiness. Light to medium body with effervescent carbonation and a dry finish. Very nice. Thanks Pollack.

Bottled 500ml (bought from Bierkraft)
Hazy yellow color, small white head, Tart, a bit fruity nose, bretta. Medium-bodied. Tart, watermelon, peach, citrus, lemon peels, bitterness and alcohol. Is there some peat? Maybe. Saison-like, quite strong as such.

Bottled (thanks to the almighty TBone!). Hazy yellowish orange colour, small white head. Aroma is farmyard, spices, some herbs and mild leathery notes. Very pleasant. Flavour is spices, earth, mild farmyardy stuff, some citruus fruits and a bit yeast.

(16.9oz bottle from Total Wine Henderson).  Pours a hazy golden color with a massive chunky white head.  Active carbonation.  Aroma has plenty of earthiness and some funk and some herbs.  Taste is mildly sweet with some traditional saison notes and more earthy/tart notes.  I dont get much of the smoke in this unless it adds a bit of savory.  Medium bodied and a dry finish.  Quite tasty.  Damn, I should have picked up more of this when I had the chance.

Botella, bought @ the brewery in Sep. 11. Hazy golden like, white head, medium, lively. Pleasant bit smoky malty spiced fruity aroma. Good mouthfeel.  Mild smoked flavour with spice, fruit  and malt., some sweetness.

500 ml bottle. Golden body with a big, creamy white heat, heavy carbonation. Aroma is light malty with fruity spices. Mild but incredible nice aroma. Flavor is fruity, soft malty, spicy and gives a farmhouse impression. A nice touch of Brett. Delicious.

500 mL bottle. Pours pale yellow with a huge, foamy, white head. The aroma is strong citrus and wheat, with a lot of brett funk, barnyard must, and just a touch of oak and smoke. The flavor is very sweet, with a lot of sourness and funk in the middle. The finish is mildly smoky and dry. The palate is light to medium, lively and effervescent, acidic, and smooth. Overall, this is a light and drinkable beer, but very complex and delicious. Nicely done.

Pours  a smokey dirty yellow.... A little akin to a trucker bomb. Smells heavily of ginger and nutmeg. Interesting flavor of orchard apple, some pear... Very different. In a good way. Very clean and crisp.. A bit sharp. Well done.

Bottle shared with coyotehunter. Pours a hazy straw color with a massive head and aromas of lemon, a light funk, juniper and ginger. Flavor is a lovely and light mix of these with a nice honey sweetness and chamomile herbal presence. Very nice beer. I would have thought a Viking saison to be a little meaner.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle. Pours golden with a huge white head. Aroma of fruitiness, spices, floral hops, some brett and green apples. Flavor is sweet and somewhat funky with some fruitiness and spices. Medium body, average carbonation. Dry finish.

On tap at Maxs during todays Stillwater event. Served in a cervoise. Saison brewed with juniper.

Pours a nice golden color with a good white head and a bit of lacing on the way down. The nose brings a bit of juniper along with a nice earthy presence. Light wheat and a bit of bubble gum and clove. The flavor is mildly spicy with light clove and a bit of earth. Light juniper and a background of wheat. Light-medium body with a touch of alcohol. Slight bitterness to the finish. Really nice.

500ml bottle pours cloudy medium yellow with a thick pillow of white foam perched on top.  It is a beautiful beer to behold.  Aromas are funk and lemon, with a slight bit of smoke. Taste is barnyard, yeasty, a bit of spice, some lemon, and something else earthy that I cannot describe.  Body is medium and a bit chewy, with heavy carbonation. Overall, this is a delicious brew. Another winner by Brian, thanks for this one.

Sample at Ale Wine & Spirits in Powell on 01/20/2012. The beer pours a cloudy yellow color with a medium fluffy white head that diminishes slowly. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Aroma of yeast, grain and malt. Medium body with a brett yeast character and notes of fruit, grain and juniper in the background. The finish is slightly funky with a mildly floral aftertaste. Pretty good overall.

Pours heavily carbonated gold with 1-finger clingy white head.  Nose is funky rock sugary malt, hops, dry citrus.  Tastes floral, hopcitric, with funky semi-sweet fruity malt notes, and a complex finish.  This one is great.
#1164 draught; nose is decent urinal cakes, weak sour lemon, barn yard, feel is mediumbroad, carb is medium, taste is medium citrus, urinal cakes, heavy brett, rubber, late medium hops

500, capped. This isnt an easy one to figure but it was damn near the beer of the night. Pours a hazy medium gold with a nice off-white head. Nice fresh nose showing a bit of horse blanket along with spices and some sweetness as well. Creamy medium body with bright and fizzy carb. Complex mid-palate of white pepper, horse blanket, some dark spice notes, and some grassy backing. Peppery finish. Delicious.
500 ml thanks to James. Big carbonation. Big yeasty saison with tons of carbonation. Nice lemon zest and touch of brett.

500 ml bottle.  Served in a tulip, the beer pours a gold color with about an inch and a half frothy white head.  The head retention is excellent, and theres a good amount of lacing left on the glass.  Aroma is fruity and spicy, it smells like citrus (orange, lemon peel), bready malt/wheat, cloves, juniper, peppery spice and a little bit of funk.  Smells like a mix between a hefeweizen and a saison.  The brew tastes like peppery spice, orange and lemon peel, wheat, and a bit of an herbal/flowery flavor.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, its a bit creamy with high but soft carbonation.  I think this is a good overall brew, I think its worth a try.  But its not a cheap beer at $13.99 a bottle.

Draught at Paradiso Dupont. Hazy hay colored pour with a medium-sized bubbly head. Nose holds a beautiful combination of orange zest, gin, lemon fruit, rosemary, perfume, orchid, cheesecake, and bretty funk, and bready dough. The flavor brings more of the same; fruit, herbs, floral presence, and rather impressively prevalent bretty tartness. Dry finish. Wondrous stuff.

Straw pour with slight haze and a white head. Awesome citrus and lemon dough with floral perfume, cheesecake, angelfood cake, and orange peel. Medium body with excellent carbonation and a dry doughy finish.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2012 Bottle from Brian, shared at Pauls Dec 3rd tasting. Pours a bright, hazy golden body with white carbonated lacing.  Aroma is delicate pepper spice, brett, light fruity funk. Mouthfeel is perfect for a saison - medium but delicate with notes of funk, pepper, flowery spice, and fruit.

Bottle at Pauls tasting.  Pours a lightly hazed golden yellow with a medium sized white head.  Musky yeast, soft wheat and spices.  Gentle black pepper, spicy yeast.  Spicy funkiness, juniper, gentle musk.

Pale yellow gold with lasting head and lace.  Peachy tart farmhouse pixie stix aroma.  Tart peach apricot underpinnings with dry grassy funky farmhouse finish.   Nice efferevescent carbo.  Light without being watery.  Ok, I was getting loaded by the time I tasted this, but, man, was this fucking delicious.
Bottle courtesy of noodleuser, thank you! Poured a mostly clear yellow color. Aroma is a touch sour, with light citrus. Flavor is a bit lemon, with a touch of yeast - light tartness.

Pours slightly hazy gold into a tulip. Bright white head with excellent retention recedes leaving spider lacing. Sweet juniper and mild smoky funk aromas. Dry and sweet with front to back juniper and band aids.
Bottle courtesy of noodleuser, thanks!  Murky yellow color, small white head, scant lacing. Aroma of slightly funky lemon peel and hay. Taste is malty, bready, subtle lemon, light spice. Nice!

500ml Bottle:  Aroma of malt, grain, yeast, and a hint of citrus.  Poured yellow/gold in color with a medium-sized, creamy, rocky, white head that greatly diminished but lasted throughout.  Hazy.  Sparkling.  Flavor is medium sweet and light to medium bitter.  Tastes of malt, yeast, hops, grain, citrus, juniper, spice, and light Brett.  Light to medium body.  Tingly, then dry texture.  Average to lively carbonation.  Malt, yeast, hop, citrus, juniper, spice, grain, finish is medium sweet and medium bitter.  Pretty much a yeast and grain festival.

Draft. Pours hazy gold with a fluffy white head. Light funky aroma with some juniper sweetness. the flavor has a lightly funky yeasty base, some juniper sweetness, and an almost rye-like spiciness, followed by a dry and lightly funky finish. Great.
Cleer straw with good lace.  Brett funk and citrus nose.  Fully bubbly mouthfeel with dry light juniper herbal finish.  Very nice and refreshing.
Bottle at Papsøs - Thanks. Cloudy yellow - white head. Cammomile, flowery, wheaty, citrus, yeasty, peppery, spicy, juniper, light light smokey, light malty, light barnyard notes. Pleasant.

Draft at Khyber Pass. 

Pours a hazy dark golden yelowish color with banana hues and a two finger frothy, pillowy white head that very slowly fades into a lasting cap. Streaks and spots of lace left behind.

Slightly earthy aroma with funky yeast and subtle musty Brett. The juniper is evident as well but doesnt overpower, letting the brett and saison yeast shine. Some bready yeast and light fruit notes in the nose. 

Medium bodied but on the fuller end with a nice creamy texture followed by subtle barnyard funk and musty Brett. Not overpowering or too dry. The saison elements are  still evident with bready yeast, grass, straw and light fruit especially apple and pear.  Juniper gives slight earthy, spicy character but doesnt overwhelm. Well balanced with the Brett adding a crisp, funky dryness that gives it depth and complexity. Pretty good saison thats easy to drink.

Bottle 500ml.Unclear medium yellow colour with a average to large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, toasted, herbs, vegetables, moderate yeasty. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, spicy, herbs, fruity. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20111031]

Bottle at Avenue Pub, New Orleans.  Pours a cloudy straw yellow with a small white head.  Nose is citrus, brett, pineapple, light cotton candy. A pleasure to smell.  Flavor is very dry, light sweetness, light bitterness.  Didnt pick up any smoke character but that was fine with me.  Really enjoyed this one.

Bottle at Papsø.
Hazy yellow coloured with a small white head.
Spicy aroma of citrus and hops with notes of barnyard.
Fruity flavour of hops with notes of barnyard.
Spicy and hoppy finish.

bottle at papsø tasting
cloudy orange. small white head.
aroma is bretty, flowery
flavor is flowey,slightly bretty, reasonably refreshing, but also a bit boring.

Bottled. A hazy yellow beer with a thin white head. The aroma has notes of straw, lemon, yeast, and juniper berries. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, brettanomyces, pepper, and malt, leading to a dry peppery finish.

50 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is dry peppery and yeasty. Yeasty, light peppery and mild fruity. Bitter, light spiced and peachy to light mango fruity. Bitter and toasted malty finish.

Bottled. Yellow coloured. Dense off white head. Aroma of yeast, fruits, light juniper, some sourness. Flavour of juniper sweetness, light smoke, vague sourness, some fruits. Medium bodied. Ends on a vaguely smoked light sour  and fruity note.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours a cloudy yellow with a lively white head. Yeasty, spicy nose. Medium body, fairly sweet malts and fruit with a dryish bitterness. The Brett doesnt really come through though. 311011
Bottle. Golden pour with an averaged sized white head. Aromas of some Brett, spices, fruitiness, and some grassiness. Tastes of some Brett, fruits, and some vanilla.

A: Six ounce pour from the bottle. Cloudy straw yellow body.  Moderate fizzy white head that gently receded, leaving a few wisps of lacing.

S: Wheat, restrained clove, slightly floral, mineral like earthiness.  Mild brett-must in the background.

T: Vibrant brett-infused saison.  Nice floral-grassy component up front with mild apple/pear fruit notes as well as a nice dry mineral-like component in the finish.

M: Light to medium bodied.  Effervescent.  Crisp, dry, refreshing finish.

O: One of Stillwaters better efforts since their original Stateside saison.

Draft.  Cloudy amber body, white head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, juniper, some lemon, spicy.  Taste is moderately sweet, herb, yeast, some juniper, light bread,.  Soft medium body, some effervescence.

Tap at Maxs of Fells Point. The pour is a cloudy straw with sheets of white lace. Fresh, floral nose. Taste is grassy, herbal, sweet pineapple, lots of fresh yellow apple character. Perhaps a tad bit apple skin tannic. Sharp carbonation. Obvious saison character. Spicy and dry. Very good.

Tap.  Pours hazy gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with great lacing.  Aroma is Belgian yeast, huge fruity esters, black pepper, juniper, light phenolic smoke, and light malt.  Flavor is Belgian, phenolic yeast (smoke), light malt, fruity esters, chardonnay, and a dry finish.  Medium body, warmth, and carbonation.
bright gold, thing white ring and film on top. Dry horseblanket nose, bit soapy, light grass. Flavor is more Brett, grass, quite dominant, bit of perfumed hay, very dry, soft finish.
Funky peppery yeast nose, lots of funk, some pineapple and cotton candy. The taste is lightly sweet, lightly tart, lots of pepper, some honey and dough, and a little under-ripe peach. Very soft.
Golden colour with a medium-lasting white head. Aroma is citrus, malty and some hops. Flavor is very balanced of malt, citrus, spices, and a good potion of hops.
Tap at the brewhouse. Huge head with good duration. Color is yellow. Aroma and taste are citrus, spices, malt and hops. Beer has a nice freshness.
